exit_message: All 9 tasks complete. CLF-C02 study guide fully built: directory structure, 4 domain study guides, 80 practice questions, 4-week study schedule, and video/podcast resource list with ingestion commands.

tasks.name: Create study directory structure
tasks.notes: Created clf-c02/ with domains/, practice-questions/, notes/ subdirs. Added README.md hub and exam-tips.md.

tasks.name: Map CLF-C02 exam domains
tasks.notes: Created study-plan.md with all 14 task statements across 4 domains, weightings, and study priority. Also created all 4 domain outline files (domain-1 through domain-4) with detailed task statements, knowledge areas, key services, comparison tables, and practice focus sections.

tasks.name: Build Domain 1 study notes (Cloud Concepts)
tasks.notes: Domain 1 notes created during aws-2: 6 advantages, cloud models (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS), deployment models, TCO, Well-Architected 6 pillars, design principles, 6 R's migration, CAF, Snow Family, migration tools.

tasks.name: Build Domain 2 study notes (Security & Compliance)
tasks.notes: Domain 2 notes created during aws-2: Shared responsibility model with shift diagram, compliance programs (SOC/PCI/HIPAA/GDPR), encryption at-rest/in-transit, IAM (users/groups/roles/policies), best practices, MFA, Organizations/SCPs, security services (GuardDuty/Inspector/Macie/WAF/Shield), SG vs NACL comparison.

tasks.name: Build Domain 3 study notes (Cloud Technology & Services)
tasks.notes: Domain 3 notes created during aws-2: Access methods, IaC (CloudFormation/CDK), global infra (Regions/AZs/Edge), compute (EC2 pricing 5 models, Lambda, containers, serverless comparison), storage (S3 7 classes, EBS/EFS/FSx), databases (RDS/Aurora/DynamoDB/ElastiCache/Redshift), networking (VPC/subnets/LB), AI/ML services (14 services), analytics, app integration (SQS/SNS/EventBridge/Step Functions), management tools.

tasks.name: Build Domain 4 study notes (Billing & Pricing)
tasks.notes: Domain 4 notes created during aws-2: Pricing principles, compute pricing comparison, RI payment options, data transfer rules (inbound free), Free Tier 3 types, cost tools (Cost Explorer/Budgets/CUR/Pricing Calculator), Organizations consolidated billing, 5 support plans with feature matrix, Trusted Advisor 5 categories.

tasks.name: Create practice questions (80 total)
tasks.notes: Created 80 practice questions (20 per domain) in CLF-C02 format across 4 files. Includes multiple choice and multiple response questions with detailed explanations. Each file has a score tracker. Questions cover all 14 task statements: 6 advantages, migration strategies, Well-Architected, shared responsibility, IAM, encryption, security services, SG vs NACL, EC2 pricing, S3 classes, serverless, databases, networking, support plans, cost tools, Free Tier.

tasks.name: Build 4-week study schedule
tasks.notes: Created notes/study-schedule.md with 28-day plan (~40 hours total). Week 1: Cloud Concepts + Security basics. Week 2: Security completion + Core services (compute, storage, DB, networking). Week 3: AI/ML, analytics, integration, billing, all 80 practice Qs. Week 4: Targeted review, timed practice, exam prep. Each day has specific reading assignments referencing domain files, key questions to answer, and checkboxes. Updated README.md to link to schedule.

tasks.name: Identify video/podcast resources
tasks.notes: Created resources.md with: 4 top YouTube courses (freeCodeCamp/ExamPro 14hr, AWS Skill Builder 6hr, Maarek preview, TechWorld with Nana), 6 supplemental topic videos (IAM, S3, EC2, Well-Architected, Shared Responsibility, VPC), 4 podcasts (AWS Podcast, Screaming in the Cloud, Cloud Security Podcast, Day Two Cloud), official AWS free training (Skill Builder, Cloud Quest, Educate, whitepapers), paid recommendations (Maarek Udemy, Tutorial Dojo), ingestion commands for knowledge_ingest.py, and study strategy mapping resources to the 4-week schedule.

notes: Iteration 1: Created directory structure and README hub for CLF-C02 study guide.

Iteration 2: Mapped all 4 CLF-C02 exam domains with detailed study notes. Created study-plan.md (master map with all 14 task statements) plus 4 comprehensive domain files covering every testable topic. Tasks aws-2 through aws-6 completed together as the domain mapping naturally produced complete study notes.

Iteration 3: Created 80 practice questions (20 per domain) in actual CLF-C02 exam format. Mix of multiple choice and multiple response. Each question has a detailed explanation referencing study note concepts. Score trackers included for self-assessment.

Iteration 4: Built 4-week study schedule (notes/study-schedule.md). 28 days, ~1hr/day weekdays + ~2hrs/day weekends = ~40 hours. Structured progression: fundamentals -> services -> billing -> practice exams. Each day has specific file references, checklists, key questions, and target scores. Updated README.md with link.

Iteration 5: Created resources.md with curated video/podcast/training recommendations. 4 YouTube courses, 6 topic videos, 4 podcasts, AWS official free training, paid recs, and knowledge_ingest.py commands. ALL 9 TASKS COMPLETE. EXIT_SIGNAL set.
